meta_description: Museum of Glass, in the heart of downtown Tacoma, offers live glassblowing demonstrations, dynamic exhibitions, and make your own glass experiences.
hours_text:
Plan Your Visit

Impactful exhibitions, unique programs, and live glassmaking 

## Hours

Wednesday—Sunday: 10am—5pm

## Admission

Tickets may be purchased at the Admission Desk upon entering the Museum. Timed tickets are not required. Last ticket sold at 4:30pm. Please note, prices may vary due to gallery changes and/or Visiting Artists.

Museum of Glass is open late the **Third Thursday** of each month — with free admission from 5–8pm.

[ Buy Admission and Workshop Tickets → ](https://buy.acmeticketing.com/events/506/list)

**$23** \- Adults  
**$21** \- Seniors (65+)  
**$21 -** Military (Active and Veteran, with ID)  
**$14** \- Youth (6–18)  
**Free** \- Children (under 6)   
**Free** \- Museum Members - [**Join Today**](https://buy.acmeticketing.com/membership/506/join)  
**Free -** American Alliance of Museums Members and Washington Museum Association Members  
  
**Ask about EBT discounts in person at the Admission Desk.**

[ Reduced and Free Admission Programs → ](/admission-programs)

[ Directions and Parking → ](/directions-and-parking)

### **Coming from Seattle with a group?**

[Tours Northwest](https://www.toursnorthwest.com/museum-of-glass-tacoma/) offers private shuttle transportation to Museum of Glass for visitors coming from Seattle. This offer includes hotel pickup and 2.5 hours at the Museum. [Learn more here.](https://www.toursnorthwest.com/museum-of-glass-tacoma/)

The Museum Hot Shop Team with Hilltop Artists.

_Nancy Callan: Forces at Play_

# Know B...
accessibility_text:
Accessibility and   
Tips for Visiting

## Arriving

The entrance to Museum of Glass is located on the East side of the building, along the waterfront. If you’re parked in the garage, use the stairs or glass elevator located next to the pay booth to access the Main Plaza. If you are on foot, there are ramps to accommodate wheelchairs and strollers on either side of the Museum.

There are several spaces in the parking garage designated for visitors with disabilities. The glass elevator is located on the East side of the parking garage and provides easy access to the Main Plaza and Museum entrance.

[Click here for the Museum Map.](/museum-map)

## Wheelchairs

Museum of Glass is ADA-compliant and fully wheelchair-accessible. If needed, visitors may borrow wheelchairs from the Admissions Desk free of charge. They are available on a first-come, first-served basis. A Driver License or State-issued ID is required when borrowing equipment. 

## Strollers

Single wide baby strollers are permitted in the Museum. Larger strollers can be checked at the Admissions Desk. 

## Seating

There are several benches and seating options located throughout the Grand Hall and galleries. In the Theater and Hot Shop, seats are tiered with aisle access. Both of those spaces also have wheelchair accommodations. 

The Museum also has one folding cane seat that is available on a first-come, first-served basis. A Driver License or State-issued ID is required when borrowing equipment.
